message: I've not seen any about, but if you only need it for /https?/ type stuff then you may be able to get away with the modules of the same name for the time being
I was after SOCKS proxy support. All of the existing high level request modules build off node's own http module.
I've searched but I can't find a wrapper a NodeJS binding for cURL. Anyone know if theres one in dev?
@lastkarrde you can spawn a child process with the native curl http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.4.1/api/child_processes.html [although your code will be system specific after that]

Node has a http client that works as curl http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.4.2/api/http.html#http.ClientRequest and there are some libraries build in top of this, check this example http://blog.nodejitsu.com/jsdom-jquery-in-5-lines-on-nodejs
@Siedrix I was after SOCKS proxy support. All of the existing high level request modules build off node's own http module (which does not support SOCKS)
